intro: Crotalaria curtata, commonly known as the narrowleaf cowpea, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with palmately divided leaves and showy yellow flowers. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are often used in traditional medicine. Crotalaria curtata is also valued for its role in agricultural systems as a green manure crop.
